pageContext.claim: “Mortality has declined by 7 percent, and hospitalizations are declining rapidly. States that were primary hotspots, such as Florida, Texas, and Arizona have reduced cases by nearly 25 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's happy talk on the coronavirus skated over the fact that the death toll was increasing. "Based on death certificate data, the percentage of deaths attributed to pneumonia, influenza or COVID-19 (PIC) increased from week 26 – week 30 (June 27 – July 25) for the first time since mid-April," reported the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in its weekly report a few days later. "The percentage for week 32 is 8.1% and currently lower than the percentage during week 31 (12.5%); however, the percentage remains above the epidemic threshold. Percentages for recent weeks will likely increase as more death certificates are processed."
